business.headline: Explained: Why Ola Electric shares fell over 5% to hit 52-week low todayIn the past five days, Ola Electric shares have lost more than 9%, and in six months, it has crashed a whopping 52%. Since the start of this year, the stock is down over 37%.

Explained: Why Reliance share price tumbled over 3% today Foreign investors have been aggressively selling Indian equities, dragging down heavyweight stocks like RIL. The company's market value has shrunk as a result, reflecting the broader negative sentiment in the market.

Ola Electric likely to cut 1,000 jobs amid rising losses: ReportThe job cuts will affect multiple departments, including procurement, fulfilment, customer relations, and charging infrastructure. Ola Electric shares also fell 5% to hit its 52-week low of Rs 54.

How often can taxpayers switch between new and old tax regime? Salaried employees can select their tax regime at the start of each financial year. If no preference is given, employers will deduct tax under the new regime by default.
Sensex, Nifty erases early gains: Why is stock market falling today? By 11:13 AM, the S&P BSE Sensex had fallen 388.70 points to 72,809.40, while the NSE Nifty50 was down 111.50 points to 22,013.30.

Google co-founder shares 'sweet spot' of work hours for employees. Check detailsGoogle co-founder Sergey Brin expressed concern about employees working less than the recommended hours or doing the bare minimum.

Sensex, Nifty open higher as GDP growth boosts sentiment; IT, auto stocks gainThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 142.87 points to 73,340.97, while the NSE Nifty50 added 48.55 points to 22,173.25 as of 9:30 AM.

Crypto market surges $300 billion after Trump names 5 coins for strategic reserveThe total cryptocurrency market has risen about 10%, or more than USD 300 billion, in the hours since Trump's announcement, according to CoinGecko, a cryptocurrency data and analysis company.

Sebi says will challenge order directing case against Madhabi Buch, othersCalling the complainant "frivolous and habitual litigant", Sebi said that it would initiate appropriate legal steps to challenge the special court order to file a case against former chief Madhabi Puri Buch and others.

Adani Group revives US investment plans amid ongoing bribery case: ReportFor now, Adani Group's US footprint remains minimal. Past talks with American companies about petrochemical projects in Texas never led to major deals.

Paytm clarifies FEMA allegations on acquired subsidiaries. Details hereThe company is seeking legal advice and will take necessary steps to resolve the matter through appropriate regulatory processes in line with applicable laws.

US food delivery firm Grubhub lays off 500 employees. Here's whyGrubhub is laying off as many as 500 employees, over 20 per cent of its workforce, following its acquisition by Wonder. The layoffs, spanning all departments, aim to streamline operations as the company integrates with its new parent.

Tuhin Kanta Pandey assumes charge as 11th Sebi chairmanTuhin Kanta Pandey took charge as the 11th Sebi chairman, succeeding Madhabi Puri Buch, who completed her tenure. A former Finance Secretary, Pandey has been appointed for three years.

India to remain fastest growing major economy with 6.5% growth in FY26: IMFIndia's strong economic performance, the IMF said, provides an opportunity for the country to advance critical and challenging structural reforms to realise the ambition of becoming an advanced economy by 2047.

From record highs to a five-month slide: Where are Sensex, Nifty headed?From record highs to relentless losses, Dalal Street's dream run has turned into a nightmare in just a few months. Is there any relief in sight for investors or is there more pain ahead?

Zerodha's Nithin Kamath flags sharp drop in trading activity amid market crashThe stock market fell sharply on Friday, with the Sensex dropping 1,414 points and the Nifty slipping below 22,150. The heavy selling wiped out nearly Rs 9 lakh crore in market value.

Citigroup employee's typo nearly led to $81 trillion blunder. Details hereThe payment was initially overlooked by two employees before a third employee caught it. Citi later reported the incident as a 'near miss' to the Federal Reserve and the Office of the Comptroller of the Currency (OCC).

Don't miss these money deadlines in March 2025: Special FDs, ITR, and more In case you have missed reporting income or made an error in your ITR, you can still fix it. The final deadline for filing an  updated return (ITR-U) is March 31, 2025.

Sensex falls 1,400 points as trade war fears rattle D-Street, Rs 9 lakh crore goneStock market crash: During today's trading session, Dalal Street plunged as Sensex tumbled 1,414 points and Nifty sank below 22,150 amid global trade war fears and foreign sell-off, erasing nearly Rs 9 lakh crore in market value.
GDP grows at 6.2% in Q3 2024-25, up from 5.6% in Q2For the financial year 2023-24, India recorded a real GDP growth rate of 9.2%, marking the highest annual growth in the past 12 years.

Nifty posts longest monthly losing streak in 29 years, over Rs 90 lakh crore goneForeign outflows, weak earnings and global uncertainty have wiped out over Rs 90 lakh crore in investor wealth from  since September 2024, when Nifty hit an all-time high of 26,277.35.

Technicolor India shuts down, over 3,000 employees affected The company currently employs 3,200 people across India, with nearly 3,000 in Bengaluru alone. The sudden move has left several employees in shock.

RuPay Debit Select Card: Check new features effective from April 1, 2025RuPay Debit Select Cardholders can enjoy one complimentary domestic airport lounge visit each quarter and two international lounge visits a year at participating lounges (conditions apply).

India needs tariff cuts, reforms to boost investments: World Bank The World Bank report titled 'Economic Memorandum India' also highlights that for India to become a high-income country by 2047, its per capita income must grow nearly eight times current levels.

What's your best asset in 20s? Not stocks or trading, says Radhika GuptaRadhika Gupta cautioned that young professionals might be focusing on passive income too early. She believes that the best investment in your 20s is not stocks or trading but your talent and time.

Smallcap, midcap indices set for worst month in 5 years. More pain ahead?In 2025 so far, mid-cap stocks have fallen 16%, while small-cap stocks have slumped 21%. In comparison, the benchmark Nifty 50 is down 6.7%.

NPCI introduces UPI Lite's 'Transfer Out' feature. All details hereAll issuer banks and UPI Apps must implement the required changes by March 31, 2025, as mentioned in NPCI's circular dated February 21, 2025

EPFO retains 8.25% interest rate on provident fund deposits for 2024-25In February 2024, the Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) had increased the interest rate on EPF marginally to 8.25 per cent for 2023-24, from 8.15 per cent in 2022-23.

Explained: Why IT stocks like TCS, Infosys, Tech Mahindra are falling todayTech Mahindra was the biggest loser among IT stocks, down nearly 5.5% at the time publishing this report. Wipro was also down nearly 5%. Major IT firms such as TCS, Infosys and HCLTech were also down nearly 4% each.

Portfolio in red? Top mutual funds to consider amid stock market downturnInvestors are now looking for safer investment options as the markets have seen a huge correction. Mutual funds that balance risk and growth are a preferred choice among many.

Explained: Why Premier Energies shares tumbled up to 8% today The company's share price fell to a day's low of Rs 850 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE). At around 12 pm, shares of Premier Energies were down 4.46% to Rs 881.80.

Ever heard of an alimony calculator? Here's how it worksAn alimony calculator is a tool that helps in determining the estimated financial support one spouse may need to pay the other after a divorce or separation.
India, EU aim to seal free trade pact by year-endThe EU is India's biggest trade partner in goods, with trade hitting $137.5 billion in 2023-24, nearly doubling in ten years.
Meta fires 20 employees for leaking internal information to mediaThe latest round of firings came following a recent series of reports based on Mark Zuckerberg's meetings with employees.

Stock market crash: 5 things investors should know as Sensex plunges 1,400 pointsStock market crash: Retail investors, already grappling with losses, are left wondering whether this correction will continue or if a recovery is on the horizon. Here are 5 things investors need to know
Sensex crashes 1,400 points: Why stock market is falling todayAt 12:53 PM, the S&P BSE Sensex was down 1,371.42 points at 73,241.01, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 421.15 points to 22,123.90.

Bitcoin tumbles 5% to fall below $80,000 for first time since NovemberThe decline comes amid uncertainty over US President Donald Trump's trade policies, regulatory decisions on cryptocurrency, and concerns among investors after a major hack in rival digital currency ether.

Sensex plunges nearly 1,000 points, Nifty tumbles over 1%; IT, auto stocks bleedThe S&P BSE Sensex lost nearly 977.03 points to 73,635.40 at 10:06 am, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 303.60 points to 22,241.45 at 10:06 am.

Karnataka labour department finds no law violation in Infosys layoffs: ReportThe final report is expected to be submitted within a week, and a copy will also be sent to the Union labour department for further review.

Who is Tuhin Kanta Pandey? A look at his key roles in the governmentThe Appointments Committee of the Cabinet (ACC) has approved Tuhin Kanta Pandey's appointment for a term of three years. He is a 1987-batch Indian Administrative Service (IAS) officer from the Odisha cadre.

entertainment.headline: Khakee The Bengal Chapter: Jeet and Prosenjit announce release date with fun clipThe next installment of Netflix's critically acclaimed thriller series Khakee, Khakee: The Bengal Chapter will premiere on Netflix in March. The makers of the show announced its release date with a fun video.

Anupamaa actor Sudhanshu Pandey breaks silence on rumoured feud with Rupali GangulyActor Sudhanshu Pandey has addressed the ongoing rumours about a feud with his Anupamaa co-star Rupali Ganguly. In an interview, he clarified the situation and dismissed the speculations.

BRIT Awards 2025: Charli XCX wins album of the year, full winners list hereCharli XCX emerged as a major winner at the Brit Awards 2025, securing multiple accolades. Artists including Sabrina Carpenter and Billie Eilish also took home some of the biggest awards of the night.

Honey Singh's Millionaire Delhi concert: A night of nostalgia, iconic hitsHoney Singh's Delhi concert was packed with nostalgic hits, emotional tributes, surprise guests, and exclusive remixes. The rapper promised bigger things ahead as his Millionaire Tour continues.

Justin Bieber celebrates 31st birthday with family, shares rare pics of son JackPop sensation Justin Bieber marked his 31st birthday with a heartwarming family gathering. He shared rare photos with wife Hailey and their son Jack, capturing the joyous occasion.

Singer Billy Joel stumbles and falls mid-performance, fans say 'that's painful'During a recent performance, legendary musician Billy Joel stumbled and fell onstage, causing fans to worry about his health. The incident has sparked widespread concern and discussions about the artist's well-being.

At sold-out Delhi concert, Honey Singh vows to bring Grammys to India. WatchAt his Delhi concert, Honey Singh wowed fans with his hits and vowed to bring a Grammy to India, inspired by AR Rahman's Oscars win. He also expressed his deep love for Delhi and its people.

Honey Singh set to perform in Delhi, excited fans rush to the venueSinger and rapper Honey Singh is set to perform in Delhi today as part of his ongoing Millionaire India tour. Ahead of the concert, excited fans were seen rushing to the venue as soon as the gates opened.

Honey Singh on online negativity against him: I've been here before YouTube existedSinger and rapper Honey Singh took a dig at those spreading negativity about him through YouTube podcasts. During his Lucknow concert last night, he also spoke about his lifestyle changes.

Shreya Ghoshal's X account hacked: Tried every thing in my capacityRenowned singer Shreya Ghoshal has disclosed that her X account has been compromised since February 13. Despite efforts, she remains unable to access or delete the account.
Splitsvilla 15's Rushali Yadav-Harsh Arora engaged: Just perfectly usSplitsvilla 15 contestants Rushali Yadav and Harsh Arora are now engaged. The couple fell in love on the show.

Nadaaniyan trailer: Ibrahim, Khushi's romance comes with a priceIbrahim Ali Khan is all set to making his acting debut in Nadaaniyan, a love story with a secret deal. Also starring Khushi Kapoor, the film explores romance, ambition, and chaos. It will start streaming on Netflix from March 7.

general news.headline: MK Stalin urges Tamil people to have babies immediately to counter delimitationTamil Nadu Chief Minister MK Stalin urged people to have children immediately, warning that population-based delimitation could reduce the state's parliamentary representation due to its success in family planning.

Congress's damage control, asks leader to delete post fat-shaming Rohit SharmaCongress spokesperson Shama Mohamed stirred controversy by calling Rohit Sharma "fat for a sportsman" and the "most unimpressive" captain India has had. The BJP criticised the Congress and accused the party of "body-shaming" a World Cup winner.

Suspect had affair with Congress worker, killed her due to extortion: SourcesThe accused, Sachin, was arrested in Delhi on Monday, two days after Himani's body was found stuffed in a suitcase near a bus stand in Rohtak.

Relief to Madhabi Buch, others as High Court halts fraud case against them The legal counsel for various SEBI and BSE officials argued that the Sessions Court's order was legally unsustainable since the respondents -- officials named in the complaints -- had not even been issued a notice.

Every species plays a vital role, safeguard their future: PM on World Wildlife DayPrime Minister Modi's reaffirmation on World Wildlife Day highlights India's active participation in global conservation initiatives, emphasising the need for ongoing efforts to protect and preserve the planet's invaluable biodiversity.

Oscar 2025 full winners list: Best film Anora dominates 97th Academy AwardsThe 97th Academy Awards have wrapped up as of March 3 in EST (March 4 in IST). Sean Baker's Anora took home 5 top honours of the night including Best Picture and Best Actress.

Trump says immigration bigger threat than Putin: Don't end up like EuropeUS President Donald Trump said that his primary concern is not Russian President Vladimir Putin but curbing illegal immigration to prevent the country from following Europe's path.

Ola Electric likely to cut 1,000 jobs amid rising losses: ReportThe job cuts will affect multiple departments, including procurement, fulfilment, customer relations, and charging infrastructure. Ola Electric shares also fell 5% to hit its 52-week low of Rs 54.

No Other Land directors call to 'stop the ethnic cleansing of Palestinian people'As No Other Land won Best Documentary Oscar, its directors called for a political solution to the Gaza conflict. They urged global action against the injustice faced by Palestinians.

Why Mamata Banerjee warned of indefinite dharna against Election Commission'Won't let outsiders occupy Bengal,' the Trinamool Congress chief has said, alleging voter list manipulation by the BJP with the Election Commission's 'help'

Kerala man killed near Jordan border, asked wife to pray for him in last callAn Indian national was shot dead by security personnel while he was allegedly attempting to cross the border illegally in Jordan, according to MEA sources. The Indian Embassy in Jordan is in touch with the victim's family.

In video message, Zelenskyy thanks US after Trump's 'not grateful' chargeFollowing a heated Oval Office exchange with Donald Trump, Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy reiterated his gratitude for US support in the war against Russia, emphasising that Ukraine's resilience relies on its allies.

Cracks to craftsmanship: Varun Chakravarthy redesigns his Dubai storyIndia vs New Zealand: Dubai was once where Varun Chakravarthy's international career hit its lowest point. Nearly four years later, he returned to the same ground, taking a five-wicket haul in the Champions Trophy, thereby engineering the downfall of New Zealand on Sunday, March 02.

Beauty industry raises the bar: Top trends for 2025From cutting-edge skincare technologies to the rise of preventive wellness rituals, here's what's inspiring the dynamic narrative of the beauty industry

'Justice for Demi Moore' trends after Mikey Madison wins Best ActressHollywood actor Demi Moore, despite receiving critical acclaim for her role in The Substance, was snubbed at the Oscars 2025. She lost Best Actress to Mikey Madison, which has led to widespread outrage among fans.

Haryana man creates Dhyaadi.com, LinkedIn's alternative for 'rejected' job-seekersIn a now-viral video on Instagram, a man from Haryana, currently living in Canada, introduced his newly-created job-searching platform for 'rejected' workers - Dhyaadi.com.

Sparkle, drama and bows: All about top fashion moments from Oscars 2025If this year's Oscars fashion moments are anything to go by, bling remains king, while bows are poised for another standout year.

Zelenskyy taunts Trump ally, offers Ukraine citizenship after resignation callsUkrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy dismissed calls to resign by US officials. Intended to reset US-Ukraine ties, the meeting grew confrontational, leading Lindsey Graham to suggest Zelenskyy step aside or send a replacement for negotiations.

Watch: Assam girl, 8, stuns Britain's Got Talent judges with incredible dance performanceBinita Chhetry, an eight-year-old girl from Assam, delighted judges of Britain's Got Talent with her incredible dance performance. Her video has gone viral on social media.

Delhi High Court sets guidelines for student smartphone use, no complete banThe Delhi High Court has framed guidelines for student smartphone use in schools, while rejecting a total ban. It stressed the need for regulation to balance educational benefits and potential risks.

Conan O'Brien is the Oscars host we needed and deservedFormer late-night host and writer Conan O'Brien hosted the 97th Academy Awards on March 3 (IST). From punchlines to some good-natured teasing, O'Brien kept a tight leash on the ship whilst providing the much-needed entertainment.

How often can taxpayers switch between new and old tax regime? Salaried employees can select their tax regime at the start of each financial year. If no preference is given, employers will deduct tax under the new regime by default.

Google co-founder shares 'sweet spot' of work hours for employees. Check detailsGoogle co-founder Sergey Brin expressed concern about employees working less than the recommended hours or doing the bare minimum.

One Down, two to Go: Private missions make a beeline for the MoonThe simultaneous presence of multiple lunar landers en route to the Moon highlights the rapid advancement of lunar services and the increasing role of private companies in space exploration.

BTS' J-hope's Seoul concert: New song, fan proposal and special appearance by JinBTS member and rapper J-hope recently held a concert in Seoul which was attended by his close friend and singer Kim Seokjin (Jin). The concert was one big event for the fans as it consisted of many other surprises besides the central performance by the artiste.

Timothee Chalamet-Kylie Jenner at Oscars 2025: Romance, chemistry and viral momentsTimothée Chalamet and Kylie Jenner were almost inseparable during the 2025 Oscars. The couple exchanged steamy glances, shared passionate kisses, and didn't shy away from PDA at the star-studded event.

The Paradise promo: Nani is oppressed leader as he headlines story of scary crowsNatural Star Nani's much-awaited glimpse of The Paradise was unveiled on March 3. The hard-hitting promo narrates the story of an oppressed leader and scary crows.

'Justice for Demi Moore' trends after Mikey Madison wins Best ActressHollywood actor Demi Moore, despite receiving critical acclaim for her role in The Substance, was snubbed at the Oscars 2025. She lost Best Actress to Mikey Madison, which has led to widespread outrage among fans.

sports.headline: Axar Patel relishing promoted batting role: Can do well with confidence Axar Patel credited his improved batting confidence to his promoted position in India's lineup, which allowed him to play freely. His crucial 42-run knock against New Zealand proved vital in India's unbeaten Champions Trophy group-stage campaign.

Playing Varun unbelievably good decision from Rohit-Gambhir: R AshwinRavichandran Ashwin praised Rohit Sharma and Gautam Gambhir for backing Varun Chakravarthy against New Zealand. He highlighted how Varun's five-wicket haul could be a game-changer for India's Champions Trophy semi-final against Australia on March 4 in Dubai.

India will be favourites vs Australia in semi-final on Dubai track: GavaskarSunil Gavaskar feels that India will be the favourites against Australia in the semi-final of the Champions Trophy 2025 as they're playing in Dubai. India continued their fine form in Dubai with another win over New Zealand.

Want to see big hundred from Shreyas Iyer in semi-final vs Australia: S SreesanthFormer India pacer S. Sreesanth has said that he wants to see a big hundred from Shreyas Iyer in India's semi-final against Australia in Dubai in the Champions Trophy 2025. Shreyas is in fine form for India during the Champions Trophy.

Why is the Champions Trophy venue setup getting so chaotic?South Africa and Australia's early travel to Dubai before their semi-final opponents and venue were confirmed has sparked criticism on the ICC's handling of the Champions Trophy match distribution, especially after the pre-tournament drama involving India and Pakistan.

Definitely planned out, not luck: Varun Chakravarthy on 5 for 42 vs New ZealandVarun Chakravarthy has claimed that all the wickets he took in the match against New Zealand were planned out and not down to luck. Varun's 5 for 42 did feature Willo Young chopping on to the stumps and Michael Bracewell not reviewing a call that would have seen him extend his time at the crease.

India bowled beautifully despite Dubai advantage: New Zealand's Matt HenryNew Zealand pacer Matt Henry acknowledged India's advantage of playing all their Champions Trophy fixtures at the Dubai International Stadium but credited their bowlers, especially Varun Chakravarthy's five-wicket haul, for securing a dominant win and extending their unbeaten run.

Shreyas Iyer on Indian team comeback after whirlwind 1.5 years: It's you vs youShreyas Iyer opened up on the mantra he followed during the last one and a half years, which were filled with highs and lows for him as he established himself as a starter in the Indian team lineup once again. Shreyas continued his fine run of form in the Champions Trophy.

Ganguly hails India favourites for Champions Trophy: Can defeat anyoneSourav Ganguly backed India to beat any opponent in the Champions Trophy after their dominant win over New Zealand. With an unbeaten group-stage run, India now faces Australia in the semi-final as strong title favourites.

IND vs NZ | Varun Chakravarthy elated with Dubai redemption: Looks good right nowVarun Chakravarthy was elated with his performance in Dubai against New Zealand in the Champions Trophy on Sunday, March 2. Varun picked up a brilliant 5-wicket haul against New Zealand in Dubai.

Australia name Cooper Connolly as injured Matthew Short's replacementAustralia have named Connor Connolly as Matthew Short's replacement for the Champions Trophy semi-final against India. Short suffered a calf injury against Afghanistan, ruling him out of the tournament, while Connolly's all-round abilities add balance to the squad.

Shreyas continued his fine run of form in the Champions Trophy.

Short suffered a calf injury against Afghanistan, ruling him out of the tournament, while Connolly's all-round abilities add balance to the squad.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
